channel.title: ebpf on Nicole van der Hoeven
channel.description: Recent content in ebpf on Nicole van der Hoeven

item.title: How to Deploy Grafana Beyla on Kubernetes as a Sidecar Container
item.description:
Principal Staff Engineer Nikola Grčevski demonstrates how to deploy Grafana Beyla on Kubernetes as a sidecar container. Grafana Beyla is an eBPF auto-instrumentation tool for application observability: you just have to tell it what to listen to, give it permissions, and deploy it– and you can see metrics and logs from that component or service without having to do any manual instrumentation.

Links

  • Instructions for deploying Grafana Beyla on Kubernetes
  • Grafana Beyla on GitHub

item.title: Introduction to eBPF With Grafana Beyla (Grafana Office Hours #25)
item.description:
Nikola Grčevski, Principal Software Engineer at Grafana Labs, gives us an introduction to eBPF with Grafana Beyla. We discuss what is eBPF, how you can use it to auto-instrument applications, and how to get started with Beyla. eBPF observability is all the rage because we all want automagical instrumentation– but does it live up to that promise? Nikola’s here to tell us what eBPF can and can’t do, and where he’d like to take Beyla next.

Links

  • Grafana Beyla repo
  • Grafana Beyla docs
  • Application Observability docs

item.title: Observability Trends and Future Best Practices (k6 Office Hours #59)
item.description: What are some observability trends and best practices in 2022 and going forward? Technical Program Manager Daniel González Lopes joins Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Paul Balogh to chat about trending concepts and new areas of exploration in the field of observability. We’re going to talk about distributed tracing, continuous profiling, eBPF monitoring, and more!

item.title: How I Learn in Obsidian - Keeping up with tech trends
item.description: Here’s how I learn in Obsidian by processing articles I’ve read into consolidated notes that help me understand technical concepts. I also show how I improve my learning by incorporating visual elements using Obsidian Excalidraw, Excalibrain, and Advanced Slides.
